headline.seo: Supreme Court Nominees Were Blocked Long Before Bork

docs.snippet: The verb “to Bork” may seem like a dig at an honored martyr of the right, but the campaign to defeat him was neither unprecedented nor illegitimate....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof David Greenberg contends campaign to defeat nomination of Robert H Bork to Supreme Court was neither unprecedented nor illegitimate; observes that Senate, until relatively recently, took seriously its role to provide 'advice and consent' in judicial nomination process through much of country's history.
docs.lead_paragraph: The verb “to Bork” may seem like a dig at an honored martyr of the right, but the campaign to defeat him was neither unprecedented nor illegitimate.

headline.seo: Municipal Assembly Votes to Restore Monument of Stalin

docs.snippet: The decision to restore a monument of Joseph Stalin was a rebuke to President Mikheil Saakashvili, who has tried to clear Georgia of all vestiges of Soviet symbolism....
docs.abstract: Municipal assembly in Gori, Georgia, votes to restore monument of Stalin as rebuke to Pres Mikheil Saakashvili, who has tried to clear country of all vestiges of Soviet symbolism.
docs.lead_paragraph: The decision to restore a monument of Joseph Stalin was a rebuke to President Mikheil Saakashvili, who has tried to clear Georgia of all vestiges of Soviet symbolism.

headline.print_headline: A Stickler for Order Finds Chaos as Usual
headline.seo: Giants’ Coughlin, Stickler for Order, Sees Another Season in Chaos
headline.main: A Stickler for Order Finds Chaos as Usual

docs.snippet: Giants coach Tom Coughlin is known for his intensity, but as his teams tend to have midseason slides, a potential downside of that type of leadership is increased emotional fatigue among players....
docs.abstract: Many New York Giants fans are questioning whether coach Tom Coughlin’s demanding style plays a role in his teams’ frequent midseason slides.
docs.lead_paragraph: Giants coach Tom Coughlin is known for his intensity, but as his teams tend to have midseason slides, a potential downside of that type of leadership is increased emotional fatigue among players.

headline.print_headline: Marijuana, Not Yet Legal for Californians, Might as Well Be
headline.seo: Stigma Fading, Marijuana Common in California
headline.main: Marijuana, Not Yet Legal for Californians, Might as Well Be

docs.snippet: Marijuana can be smelled in suburban backyards in neighborhoods from Hollywood to Topanga Canyon as dusk falls — what in other places is known as the cocktail hour....
docs.abstract: Recreational marijuana use in California, despite fact that it is still technically illegal, is losing whatever stigma it once had; people from all walks of society, including community and public leaders, are openly using drug both at home and in public; many officials, including California's lieutenant governor Gavin Newsom, support its legalization.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marijuana can be smelled in suburban backyards in neighborhoods from Hollywood to Topanga Canyon as dusk falls — what in other places is known as the cocktail hour.

headline.print_headline: Palestinian Premier Calls for Boycott of Israeli Goods
headline.seo: Palestinian Premier Fayyad Calls for Boycott on Israeli Goods
headline.main: Palestinian Premier Calls for Boycott of Israeli Goods

docs.snippet: Israel’s refusal this month to transfer tax revenue to the West Bank has undermined the Palestinian Authority’s already dire finances, the prime minister, Salam Fayyad, said....
docs.abstract: Israel’s refusal to transfer tax revenue to West Bank undermines Palestinian Authority’s already dire finances, prompting its prime minister, Salam Fayyad, to call for boycott of Israeli goods; move by Israel is seen as part of tit-for-tat response to Palestinians’ successful bid to upgrade their status at United Nations to nonmember observer state.
docs.lead_paragraph: Israel’s refusal this month to transfer tax revenue to the West Bank has undermined the Palestinian Authority’s already dire finances, the prime minister, Salam Fayyad, said.

headline.print_headline: A Million Users Desert BlackBerry, and Revenue Falls 48%
headline.main: A Million Users Desert BlackBerry, and Revenue Falls 48%

docs.snippet: The maker of BlackBerry phones, Research in Motion, posted the data on the loss of customers and revenue on Thursday in its third-quarter results....
docs.abstract: Research in Motion reports third-quarter net income of $9 million, or 2 cents a share, down from $265 million, or 51 cents a share, in the same period a year earlier; revenue fell 48 percent in fiscal third quarter, to $2.7 billion from $5.2 billion year earlier; announces that it lost a million BlackBerry owners worldwide during the quarter.
docs.lead_paragraph: The maker of BlackBerry phones, Research in Motion, posted the data on the loss of customers and revenue on Thursday in its third-quarter results.

headline.print_headline: Use of Death Sentences Continues to Fall in U.S.
headline.seo: Use of Death Sentences Continues to Fall, Numbers Show
headline.main: Use of Death Sentences Continues to Fall in U.S.

docs.snippet: Thirty-six years after the Supreme Court reinstated the death penalty, its use is waning; new data show 80 death sentences were handed down in 2012, about a third of the total in 2000....
docs.abstract: Data for 2012 shows that use of death penalty is waning in United States, thirty-six years after Supreme Court reinstated practice; 80 death sentences were handed down in 2012, about one-third of total in 2000.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty-six years after the Supreme Court reinstated the death penalty, its use is waning; new data show 80 death sentences were handed down in 2012, about a third of the total in 2000.

headline.print_headline: OSHA Says It Is Investigating Garage Employee’s Drowning
headline.seo: Drowning in Parking Garage During Hurricane Sandy Is to Be Investigated
headline.main: OSHA Says It Is Investigating Garage Employee’s Drowning

docs.snippet: The agency is examining possible safety violations at the garage and, if any exist, what connection they may have to the death during Hurricane Sandy of one of its employees....
docs.abstract: Occupational Safety and Health Administration is examining possible violations of federal safety standards in the death of Anthony Narh, a 58-year-old immigrant from Ghana who drowned during Hurricane Sandy at the underground parking garage in Manhattan where he worked.
docs.lead_paragraph: The agency is examining possible safety violations at the garage and, if any exist, what connection they may have to the death during Hurricane Sandy of one of its employees.

headline.print_headline: Redskins’ Griffin Appears to Be Ready to Face Eagles
headline.seo: Redskins’ Griffin Appears Ready to Go
headline.main: Redskins’ Griffin Appears to Be Ready to Face Eagles

docs.snippet: Robert Griffin III, Washington’s rookie quarterback who missed last week’s game with a sprained right knee, had a full practice Thursday for the second straight day....
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Washington Redskins quarterback Robert Griffin III has his first full practice since knee injury; other football developments noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert Griffin III, Washington’s rookie quarterback who missed last week’s game with a sprained right knee, had a full practice Thursday for the second straight day.

headline.print_headline: Canada: Court Seeks a Balance on Veils
headline.main: Canada: Court Seeks a Balance on Veils

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court of Canada ruled Thursday that witnesses could cover their faces for religious reasons while testifying in court under some circumstances....
docs.abstract: Supreme Court of Canada rules that witnesses can cover their faces for religious reasons while testifying in court under some circumstances, after Muslim woman asked to wear niqab.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court of Canada ruled Thursday that witnesses could cover their faces for religious reasons while testifying in court under some circumstances.
